text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
The September 18, 2013 IRM 4.24.17 is updated to reﬂect the changes listed in the table below. This section provides guidance pertaining to ExSTARS Compliance Examination Procedures.
MATERIAL CHANGES
Updated IRM 4.24.17 material changes are reﬂected in the following table:

Description of Change Cosmetic and IRM style guide changes made throughout this IRM section. Organizational names and titles were updated throughout. Changed section title and removed reporting requirements referenced in Publication

EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

This material supersedes IRM 4.24.17, dated 09/18/2013. This IRM contains procedural guidance found in reissued interim guidance, SBSE-04-0316-0011, New MFT and Activity Code for IRC 6675, 6718, and 6725 Penalty Assessments, dated 03/03/2016 and National Headquarters interim guidance, NHQ-04-0516-0001, Change in Policy on Initial Taxpayer Contact in Examination Cases, dated 05/20/2016.
AUDIENCE
Table of Contents
Introduction to Excise Summary Terminal Activity Reporting System (ExSTARS) Compliance
Excise Summary Terminal Activity Reporting System (ExSTARS) Compliance Examination Procedures 4.24.17
) IRC
(d) authorizes the IRS to require information reporting from any person who is registered under IRC
and from any other person who IRS deems necessary to administer fuel tax rules. Under Treas. Reg. §
, any person that is required to ﬁle these information reports ﬁle the reports for a calendar month. These reports must be ﬁled by the the month following the month to which the report relates. (
) The IRS requires terminal operators to ﬁle Form
-TO, Terminal Report, to report the receipt and disbursement of all liquid products. The also requires bulk carriers to ﬁle Form

-CS, Carrier Summary Report. Vessel operators report all liquid product receipts and disbursements to from approved terminals and reﬁneries designated with a Terminal Control Number (TCN) and Reﬁnery Control Number (RCN), respectively. A operator only reports receipts and disbursements to and from an approved terminal designated with a TCN. (
) IRC
(d) requires any person with
or more reportable transactions those transactions required to be reported on Form
-TO and
-CS ) month to ﬁle any report required pursuant to IRC
(d) in an electronic format. (
) E
TARS is an electronic data interchange system that was developed by federal, state, and industry stakeholders to facilitate compliance with the tronic ﬁling requirement of IRC
(d). The IRS uses the information through E
TARS to plan fuel tax compliance and taxpayer service Therefore, it is important that the IRS ensures that the information gathered through E
TARS is accurate. E
TARS compliance examinations are an integral part of the IRS’s overall fuel tax compliance strategy. (

) The IRS issues a Facility Control Number (FCN) to designate a storage location within the motor fuel, renewable fuel production, or bulk transfer/ terminal system. Operators of an approved FCN facility apply to register the IRS for an RCN or TCN respectively, through the Form
process. Currently, a terminal with a TCN is the only FCN required to ﬁle E
TARS reports. Note: Vessel and pipeline operators are not issued an FCN but must ﬁle
) E
TARS compliance examinations are conducted by Excise Fuel Territory Revenue Agents (RA) and Fuel Compliance Agents (FCA), referred to as “excise examiners” in this IRM section. (
) The excise examiner is required to utilize management-speciﬁed software for all E

TARS compliance examinations. The Issue Management System (IMS) with affiliated Notebook, which provides lead sheet templates, reports, letters, and closing forms, is the current excise tax examination case software system. (
) The scope of an E
TARS compliance examination is limited to E
TARS ﬁling requirement issues concerning: • Failure to make a report on or before the date prescribed
• Failure to include correct information • Failure to report electronically (
or more monthly transactions) (
) E

TARS compliance examination primary objectives are to: • Identify Large, Unusual, and Questionable (LUQ) items • Ensure report data is accurate and timely • Identify and develop fraud issues, when applicable • Improve the probability of future reporting compliance • Apply IRC
and
penalties impartially and consistently across the fuel tax territories (
) IRC
imposes on any person required to ﬁle reports under IRC
(d) a penalty for failing to ﬁle the report or for failing to include all required informa- tion on the report. Absent reasonable cause, the penalty is $
per failure for each vessel or facility (e.g., a terminal or other facility) for which is required to be furnished. (
) During an E
TARS compliance examination, the excise examiner should determine whether the person under examination is required to register with the IRS under IRC
(a) and if so, conﬁrm their registration status. While requirement to register and the information reporting requirements under IRC
(d) are independent of each other, most persons with an IRC
(d) in- formation reporting obligation are also required to be registered under IRC
(a). Absent reasonable cause, IRC
imposes a penalty of $
each initial failure and $
for each day that the failure to register or rereg- ister continues. Note: An example of a person that has an information reporting obligation, but is not required to register under IRC
(a), is a vessel operator that only transports nontaxable liquids to or from a terminal. (
) Tax liability matters/issues identiﬁed during an E
TARS compliance tion are referred to Excise Case Selection (ECS), Workload Selection and Delivery (WSD). Excise examiners should prepare Form
, Examination Information Report, with supporting documentation and submit, to the for approval. Once approved, submit Form
via secure e-mail to the WSD. (
) Form
registration deﬁciencies identiﬁed during E
TARS compliance ex- aminations must receive group manager concurrence. Submit Form
, to the group manager for approval. Once approved, submit Form
to the Form
Registration Group Manager for registrations not under (
) Generally, a Facility Control Number (FCN) questionnaire is needed to status changes to approved FCN facilities. However, if E
TARS compliance examination technical support is needed, submit a Guidance Request Memo- randum (GRM) to Fuel Policy: See IRM
, Requesting Excise Subject Matter Expert (SME) Assistance for GRM procedures. (

) The excise examiner may contact third parties if LUQ items are identiﬁed. example; an excise examiner is unable to locate a corresponding bulk carrier Third disbursement report for a terminal receipt under examination, or a bulk carrier registration status is in question. The excise examiner should make a third party contact with the carrier reported to resolve the potential reporting issue Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

or more monthly transactions) (

and

) Generally, a Facility Control Number (FCN) questionnaire is needed to status changes to approved FCN facilities. However, if E
TARS examination technical support is needed, submit a Guidance Request randum (GRM) to Fuel Policy: See IRM
, Requesting Excise Matter Expert (SME) Assistance for GRM procedures. (

) The excise examiner may contact third parties if LUQ items are identiﬁed. example; an excise examiner is unable to locate a corresponding bulk Third disbursement report for a terminal receipt under examination, or a bulk registration status is in question. The excise examiner should make a third party contact with the carrier reported to resolve the potential reporting issue

) The excise examiner may contact third parties if LUQ items are identiﬁed. For example; an excise examiner is unable to locate a corresponding bulk carrier Third disbursement report for a terminal receipt under examination, or a bulk carrier registration status is in question. The excise examiner should make a third party contact with the carrier reported to resolve the potential reporting issue or
Terminal Activity Reporting System Compliance Examination Procedures
check the registration status of the carrier. The examiner must follow the cation requirements of IRC
(see IRM
, Examining Officers Third Party Contacts). (
) Taxpayer privacy rights must be protected when making third party The excise examiner should not discuss information that is subject to the party notiﬁcation requirements under IRM
, Examining Officers Third Party Contacts, and should not review third party information that rise to the level of an examination. (
) A TCN is used to identify individual terminals. (
) The FCN Coordinator receives FCN requests from facility operators, Guidance examiners, and Fuel Compliance Officers (FCOs). Facility (FCN) (

) For FCN issues employees will: a. Verify whether the terminal operator is a taxable fuel registrant with an Activity Letter “S” in the event a TCN is issued. b. If applicable, create or update the IMS Form
case ﬁle work Note: Secure an initial Form

application if creating a new case c. Determine TCN requirements. d. Conduct an on-site inspection to verify status changes. Note: The FCN Coordinator and RA may request a site visit by an or FCA through the appropriate fuel territory group manager. e. Submit FCN questionnaire to FCN Coordinator to update facility f. The FCN Coordinator communicates the determination to the facility. (
) Facilities may have more than one FCN. For example, a reﬁnery with an may also meet the deﬁnition of an approved terminal, which would require facility to also have a TCN. (
) The FCN Coordinator updates the applicable FCN location directory found the IRS web page. See the following links: https://www.irs.gov/Businesses/ (

) FCN facilities are required to contact the FCN Coordinator if there is a in operator or business operations. Notiﬁcation may be via fax, phone or Guidance for e-mail. The FCN Coordinator will follow authentication requirements found IRM
, Requirements for Verbal or Electronic Requests, during contact. (

) Veriﬁcation is required for any FCN status update. The FCN Coordinator RA must request a site visit by an FCO or FCA, through the appropriate territory group manager, to verify the terminal status change. (
) The FCN Coordinator makes ﬁnal determination for all FCN status change requests. (
) The FCN Coordinator will notify the facility of status change. (

, Examining Officers Guide/ Third Party Contacts, and should not review third party information that would rise to the level of an examination.
(12-20-2016) Procedural Guidance Relating to Facility Control Number (FCN)
Submit FCN questionnaire to FCN Coordinator to update facility status. The FCN Coordinator communicates the determination to the facility.
The FCN Coordinator makes ﬁnal determination for all FCN status change
) FCN numbers are not removed from the E
TARS database; however, IRS web page only displays approved FCN location directories. See IRM
for more information on approved FCN facilities. (

) The excise examiner improves classiﬁcation, workload selection, and ment by providing information to EOS regarding industry trends, Workload arrangements, and preferences within his or her jurisdiction. and (
) IRM
provides workload stratiﬁcation guidance speciﬁc to examination activities. (
) IRC
compliance case work, includes: • Form
-TO/CS E
TARS compliance examinations • Form
Registration initial applications and compliance reviews • IRC
and
penalty cases (
) An IRC
compliance examination is assigned at journey level or grade. (
) Grade level assignments may differ between IRC
compliance case and Form
examinations. Group manager assignment of a related
examination as a part of the IRC
compliance examination will an adjustment from the journey level or below status to match that of the
case grade. (
) The primary IRC
compliance case plus any subsequent and/or prior periods, or any related IRC
compliance case work, controlled by an excise examiner, will carry the same grade level. (
) A related registrant that is examined by other excise examiners will be separately. (
) To expand the scope of IRC
compliance case work to a Form
nation or Form
, Claim for Refund of Excise Taxes, the excise must submit a referral using Form
, to the group manager. (
) When information reports are submitted through E
TARS, the system validates speciﬁc data ﬁeld, syntax, and string structure, as described in Report Filings
, Motor Fuel Excise Tax EDI {Electronic Data Interchange} Guide. validation process does not verify accuracy of the information or identify omitted transactions. E
TARS generates an error report if issues are detected during the validation process. (
) Examples of situations that would generate error reports are entering: • An invalid EIN or a social security number •
, or
as the EIN for a terminal operators, position holder or bulk carrier •
as the EIN for a Department of Defense (DOD) carrier consignor •
as the EIN for a carrier that operates a foreign-ﬂagged vessel •
as the EIN for any situation other than to report rail or carriers when EIN is unknown
Excise Summary Terminal Activity Reporting System (ExSTARS) Compliance Examination Procedures 4.24.17 page
) Upon submitting monthly data, information providers receive an ment for the receipt of every electronic information report: a. Transmission acknowledgement (ACK) (
) ﬁle, and b. Validation (
) ACK ﬁle. (
) The ACK ﬁles are placed in the participant’s electronic mailbox, set up as of the EDI testing. (
) Filing date evidence is the receipt date of a
-A (accepted) ACK and a ACK. A TS-
ACK ﬁle is created every time an E
TARS Information Provider or Approved Excise Third Party Transmitter submission is transmitted. (
) If the information provider receives a TS-
ACK with an “A” in the AK
segment, followed by a TS-
ACK Level
error, then the transaction set been rejected in its entirety. The information provider is required to correct problem and resubmit the transaction set as an original ﬁle. TS-
ACK are considered “must ﬁx errors” requiring correction within
calendar days be deemed timely ﬁled. (
) The period of limitations is the allowable time in which the IRS may make assessment regarding an E
TARS report. A person must ﬁle a report to the limitation period provision. The period of limitations will remain open Extensions nitely if the person does not ﬁle a report. (
) E
TARS information reports do not post to the Integrated Document System (IDRS), therefore a statute of limitation (SOL) date will not automati- cally post to the Master File. The E

TARS report ﬁling date can generally found in the case ﬁle building materials. If the SOL cannot be determined, excise examiners shall use the Request For Information (RFI) form to data from the Joint Operations Center (JOC) and forward the request to the manager for approval. The manager will process the RFI, which transmits directly to the JOC mailbox. The RFI can be found on the JOC web page at (
) Pursuant to IRC
(a), in the case of a ﬁled Form
-TO or
-CS mation report that does not contain the required information, or contains incorrect information, the penalty imposed by IRC

generally must be assessed within three years from the due date or the date of ﬁling, is later. Note: A ﬁled paper or electronic report starts the statute of limitation running, re- gardless of the electronic ﬁling requirement. (
) In general, an examination of an E
TARS information report and of penalties must be completed timely and within the statute of limitation period. In cases where a compelling business reason exists, Form
-EX, Consent to Extend the Time on Assessment of Information Report Penalty, may be solicited. Examples of when to secure a Form
-EX extension include: a. Penalty issue(s) that require the compliance examination to remain (

Penalty issue(s) that require the compliance examination to remain active.

and
may be imposed an examination. b. Statute of limitation period will expire within
days c. There is insufficient time to complete and process the case. For an examination with less than
months remaining on the statute of tations, cannot be initiated without group manager approval. (
) The excise examiner must secure the group manager concurrence prior to statute extension solicitation. (
) Letter
-C, Request to Extend Assessment Statute EXSTARS Statute Extension Initial Letter, along with Form

-EX are mailed to the taxpayer request extension of the statue. If the taxpayer: a. Agrees to the extension, the taxpayer will sign and return the Form EX. The excise examiner will send a copy of the signed Form
-EX the taxpayer along with Letter
-C, Transmittal to Taxpayer of Copy Signed Consent, signed by the Chief Excise Tax Program. b. Does not return a signed Form
-EX when requested, the excise examiner will mail the taxpayer follow up Letter
-C, Follow Up Requesting Return of Consent. (
) The excise examiner must submit through his or her manager Form
, AIMS/ERCS Update, upon securing Form
-EX to reﬂect the new statute date. (
) E
TARS information reports are not established on the Audit Inventory agement System (AIMS) and therefore do not post to the IDRS. E
TARS compliance examinations and associated penalties are controlled on ERCS. Assessed penalties post to IDRS under MFT

) Terminal operators may operate multiple approved terminal facilities under single Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number (TIN). The use of a substitute “TIN”, ﬂecting the facilities speciﬁc terminal control number is used for ERCS purposes. See IRM
) Bulk carriers, who report information on Form
-CS, use actual taxpayer identiﬁcation numbers. (
) E
TARS compliance case ﬁles are generally established on ERCS. If a is not established on ERCS, the excise examiner must complete and Form
-D, Examination Request-ERCS (Examination Returns Control System) Users, to the group manager. See IRM Exhibit

in the PBC ﬁeld c. Enter the excise examiner’s territory Business Code in the SBC ﬁeld d. Enter the excise examiner’s group code in the EGC ﬁeld e. Enter the Carrier Summary Tax Identiﬁcation Number (TIN) or Terminal Operator TIN for the entity under examination Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

) Case Coordination Procedures When the Exam Case is in Status
- If an MFT
examination is currently in status
, and a number of related
-TO/CS reviews (B
reviews) are identiﬁed for classiﬁcation, the WSD manager will seek input from the assigned ﬁeld group manager on the and of B
sample reviews to be selected, and where possible, the speciﬁc
locations to be reviewed. a. WSD Classiﬁcation Check Sheets for the selected B
reviews will be noted that “case coordination is required with the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
case ”. b. The excise examiner conducting the B
review must inform the case excise examiner of his or her intent to contact the taxpayer and forward to the controlling excise examiner a copy of the Form
, mation Document Request (IDR) issued to the facility. c. The excise examiner assigned to the MFT
case will schedule a ence call with the excise examiner assigned to the related B
reviews share any information pertinent to the reviews. d. When the excise examiner completes the B
review, a conference call be held with the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
examination discuss the ﬁndings prior to the issuance of any reports. e. The excise examiner will provide a copy of the B
review results via secure e-mail to the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
case for possible use/inclusion in the audit ﬁle. f. It is the responsibility of the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
to ensure consistency is achieved across all entities. Concerns will be addressed by the examination and review managers. (
) Case Coordination Procedures When the Exam Case is in Status
- If an MFT
examination is currently in status
, assigned to a ﬁeld group, a number of related B
reviews are identiﬁed for classiﬁcation, the WSD manager will seek input from the assigned ﬁeld group manager on the of B
sample reviews to be selected, and where possible, the speciﬁc locations to be reviewed. a. WSD Classiﬁcation Check Sheets for the selected B
reviews will be noted that “case coordination is required with the ﬁeld manager of the group in which the examination case resides”. b. The excise examiner conducting the B

review will notify the assigned ﬁeld examination group manager of his or her intent to contact the taxpayer and will forward to the manager a copy of the IDR being to the facility. c. When the excise examiner completes the B

review, a conference call be arranged with the excise examiner, his or her manager, and the assigned ﬁeld examination group manager to discuss ﬁndings prior to issuance of any reports. d. The excise examiner will provide a copy of the B
review results via secure e-mail to the assigned ﬁeld examination group manager for possible use/inclusion in the audit ﬁle. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
C
a. WSD Classiﬁcation Check Sheets for the selected B
reviews will be noted that “case coordination is required with the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
case ”. b. The excise examiner conducting the B
review must inform the controlling case excise examiner of his or her intent to contact the taxpayer and will forward to the controlling excise examiner a copy of the Form
, Infor- mation Document Request (IDR) issued to the facility. c. The excise examiner assigned to the MFT
case will schedule a confer- ence call with the excise examiner assigned to the related B
reviews to share any information pertinent to the reviews. d. When the excise examiner completes the B
review, a conference call will be held with the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
examination to discuss the ﬁndings prior to the issuance of any reports. e. The excise examiner will provide a copy of the B
review results via secure e-mail to the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
case for possible use/inclusion in the audit ﬁle. f. It is the responsibility of the excise examiner assigned to the MFT
case to ensure consistency is achieved across all entities. Concerns will be addressed by the examination and review managers. Case Coordination Procedures When the Exam Case is in Status

) The examination issues described in this section emphasize due dates and extensions of E
TARS information report ﬁlings. The excise examiner is reminded to always consider and document reasonable cause. (
) E
TARS information reports must be ﬁled monthly and are due on the last day of the following month. (
) A
day automatic extension is granted to requests received in writing on before the due date of a report. Additional
day extensions may be granted, if requested and received timely and contain a valid explanation. (
) The excise examiner may request E
TARS extension information by ting a GRM to the FCN Coordinator. (
) The excise examiner should consider all facts and circumstances in ation of a late ﬁled report. The group manager concurrence must be for all late ﬁled report determinations. (
) The accuracy of E

TARS information is crucial to the Service’s ability to fectively measure compliance. Timely, complete, and accurate ﬁling is essential. The examination issues described in this section emphasize potential errors that may result from noncompliant reporting. The excise examiners is reminded to always consider and document reasonable (

) Examination reports are issued only for E
TARS compliance examinations that result in a penalty assessment. Penalty and (

) Examination reports (unlike work papers) are legally binding documents, serve as the basis for assessment and collection action. Excise examiners should take all necessary precautions to ensure the accuracy and proper execution of examination reports. (
) The excise examiner contact information must be provided to the provider upon issuance of a report. Refer to IRM
, Providing Taxpayers with Employee Contact Information. (
) The procedural guidance found in IRM
Overview of Excise Responsibilities, and IRM
Procedure at Conclusion of generally apply to E
TARS compliance examinations, except where noted this IRM section. (

chapter B (Additions to the Tax, Additional Amounts, and Assessable Penalties).
